metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14615 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient control flow in certain data structures for some Intel(R) Processors with Intel(R) Processor Graphics may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access. It was discovered that the Linux kernel did not properly clear data structures on context switches for certain Intel graphics processors. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-173-generic - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-4.4.0-173-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-4.4.0-173-lowlatency - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-173.203

linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-173-generic - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-173-lowlatency - 4.4.0-173.203
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> This issue only affects systems with Intel Graphics Processing Units (GPUs) Gen8 Intel GPUs were previously fixed by commit 0160f055393f ("drm/i915/gen8: Add WaClearSlmSpaceAtContextSwitch workaround") Fixes are only available for Gen8 and Gen9 GPUs at this time Fixes for Gen6 and Gen7 may be available in the future

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-173.203').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1102.113').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.60~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1067.72').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.59').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-76.86~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1066.73').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.36~16.04.1').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-173.203').
linux-signed-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.60~16.04.1').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1067.72').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.59').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-76.86~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.141').
